docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney offered his most detailed plan yet for cutting government spending.

headline.main: Romney Debt Plan Includes Medicare Overhaul and Social Security Changes
headline.print_headline: Romney Debt Plan Includes Medicare Overhaul and Social Security Changes

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney, in a speech at the Americans for Prosperity Foundation, offers his most detailed plan yet to cut government spending and lower the federal debt, including an overhaul of Medicare and significant changes to Social Security.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney offered his most detailed plan yet for cutting government spending.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a Sunday Review article and other coverage on the cost and quality of America’s health care.

headline.main: The World Leader in Health Care Costs
headline.print_headline: The World Leader in Health Care Costs

docs.abstract: Letter from Christine K Cassel, president of the American Board of Internal Medicine, comments on Oct 28 front page story on the quality and cost of American health care.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to a Sunday Review article and other coverage on the cost and quality of America’s health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: New I.R.S. rules that went into effect this year, as part of the Affordable Care Act, made it harder for consumers to have non-prescription medicines reimbursed from health-care flexible spending accounts. To be reimbursed for over-the-counter medicines, consumers now must obtain a prescription for the items-even though a prescription isn't required to buy them in the first place.

docs.abstract: Readers respond to a blog post on the Defense of Marriage Act.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to a blog post on the Defense of Marriage Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a blog post yesterday I argued that Congress should repeal the Defense of Marriage Act, which denies the right of marriage to same-sex couples. I also suggested that we remove the ability of churches to bestow legal legitimacy on marriage. We should imitate France, where marriages must be performed by a civil authority, and religious ceremonies have no legal status.
docs.abstract: Readers respond to a blog post on the Defense of Marriage Act.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to a blog post on the Defense of Marriage Act.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Sick in America, Aching for Africa

docs.abstract: Africa's no-frills attitude toward health care is more effective than America's no-expenses-spared approach in treating diseases like malaria.
docs.snippet: Africa's no-frills attitude toward health care is more effective than America's no-expenses-spared approach in treating diseases like malaria.

docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO - I came down with my first African disease in America. It happened after I traveled to Nigeria last April to witness my country elect a new government. I landed with notebooks and questions, but not antimalarial medication. I had been more prudent on dozens of prior stays, but, I thought, no matter: I had already been running around the continent for months with no mishaps. After three rounds of free and fair voting, I returned to my apartment in Nairobi, buoyant about democracy in Africa.

headline.main: Sick in America, Aching for Africa

docs.lead_paragraph: The Public Employees Federation voted to accept a package of wage and benefit concessions sought by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, saving thousands of union jobs.

headline.seo: Public Employees Union Accepts Cuomo’s Contract Deal to Avert Layoffs
headline.main: Union Reversal on Givebacks Averts 3,500 Layoffs by State
headline.print_headline: Union Reversal on Givebacks Averts 3,500 Layoffs by State

docs.abstract: Public Employees Federation, New York State's second-largest union of public workers, votes to accept package of wage and benefit concessions sought by Gov Andrew M Cuomo, avoiding planned layoff of 3,496 union members.
docs.snippet: The Public Employees Federation voted to accept a package of wage and benefit concessions sought by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, saving thousands of union jobs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of outside interest groups are turning to a wide variety of tactics to ward off deep cuts in Congress.

headline.main: Interest Groups Try to Catch Debt Committee’s Ear
headline.print_headline: Interest Groups Seek to Catch Debt Committee’s Ear

docs.abstract: Advocates for poor, facing billions of dollars in possible cuts, are asking lawmakers to abide by $4.50 daily food budget, amount allotted to 46 million Americans who receive food stamps; effort is among hundreds by outside interest groups who hope to gain attention of Congressional budget committee charged with reducing deficit.
docs.snippet: Hundreds of outside interest groups are turning to a wide variety of tactics to ward off deep cuts in Congress.
